text:
Cameron Lake (Staten Island): Shown are three views of the pond on the extensive estate of Sir Roderick Cameron, situated on the south side of Fingerboard Road, near Clove Road. The pond was also known as Van Wagenen's Pond, and Woodside Lake.
September 12, 1911
Views 1, 2, 3

By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
title: Cameron Lake - Staten Island

title: Cameron Lake - Staten Island

text:
Clove Road, south from near Fingerboard Road (vantage-point), showing part of the valley near Cameron Lake which, according to P. L. Sperr, is the site of the Cameron Park real estate development.

May 20, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

Clove Road, south of Fingerboard Road (vantage point), showing a view of the valley near Cameron Lake. P. L. Sperr states that it is the site of the Cameron Lake real estate development. This is a set of three views taken the same day.

May 20, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

Clove Road, south of Fingerboard Road (vantage point), showing a view of the valley near Cameron Lake. P. L. Sperr states that it is the site of the Cameron Lake real estate development. This is a set of three views taken the same day.

May 20, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

Clove Road, south of Fingerboard Road (vantage point), showing a view of the valley near Cameron Lake. P. L. Sperr states that it is the site of the Cameron Lake real estate development. This is a set of three views taken the same day.

May 20, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Clove Road, south from near Fingerboard Road, showing, what P. L. Sperr refers to, as the Cameron Park real estate development.

May 20, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A view of the real estate development site near Cameron Lake, as seen from the road.

May 20, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) A view of the area in a different direction.

May 20, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Clove Road, south from near Fingerboard Road, showing, what P. L. Sperr refers to, as the Cameron Park real estate development.

May 20, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A view of the real estate development site near Cameron Lake, as seen from the road.

May 20, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) A view of the area in a different direction.

May 20, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Clove Road, south from near Fingerboard Road, showing, what P. L. Sperr refers to, as the Cameron Park real estate development.

May 20, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A view of the real estate development site near Cameron Lake, as seen from the road.

May 20, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) A view of the area in a different direction.

May 20, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Cameron Lake (Richmond): A view westward across the northern portion of the lake, showing an islet and a small bridge connecting it with the shore. The lake is on the south side of Fingerboard Road, east of Clove Road and derives its name from Roderick Cameron on whose large estate it was located.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same section of the lake and bridge as viewed in the opposite direction (eastward).

P. L. Sperr.

(3) Viewing the lake from near Hylan Boulevard.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Cameron Lake - Staten Island

title: Cameron Lake - Staten Island

text:
(1) Cameron Lake (Richmond): A view of the lake in early Spring. The lake derives its name from Sir Roderick Cameron on whose property it was formerly located. It is situated on the south side of Fingerboard Road, east of Clove Road.

April 22, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) A view of the lake at an earlier date as seen from Clove Road in an easterly direction.

May 20, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The lake at twilight.

May 20, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.
